member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Contains enums of the SDK.

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod
member.summary: This defines what method will be used by the transaction to determine the credit card used to process the transaction

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod.Direct
member.summary: The Card is supplied in the Transaction Request itself (in the Customer.CardDetails member, or from the Customer's card in the eWay vault). If supplied from the request, the Card Data can either be plaintext (for PCI Compliant Customers) or encrypted using the client-side eCrypt javascript library. For this Paymentmethod, the transaction/authorisation is processed immediately.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod.ResponsiveShared
member.summary: The Card will be supplied by redirecting the cardholder to the Responsive Shared PageeWay. For this PaymentMethod, the transaction/authorisation is processed once the cardholder submits the responsive shared page.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod.TransparentRedirect
member.summary: The Card will supplied by a form post from a Transparent Redirect page. For this PaymentMethod, the transaction/authorisation is processed when the form is posted.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod.Wallet
member.summary: The Card will be obtained from a digital wallet (e.g. Visa Checkout).

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod.Authorisation
member.summary: A previously created authorisation will be used to create the transaction by using an Auth Capture.

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.RequestMethod
member.summary: Request Method

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.RequestMethod.Authorise

member.summary: Defines the possible types of settlement reports

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.SettlementSearchMode.SummaryOnly
member.summary: This mode will ONLY query the settlement summary.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.SettlementSearchMode.TransactionOnly
member.summary: This mode will ONLY query the settlement transactions (individually).

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.SettlementSearchMode.Both
member.summary: This mode will query both the Settlement summary, as well as the settlement transactions.

member.summary: Method is unknown.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.LowCost
member.summary: A low cost method is used

member.summary: The customer has chosen the method

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.International
member.summary: Item will be shipped international

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.Military
member.summary: Item will be shipped via the military

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.NextDay
member.summary: Item will be delivered the next day

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.StorePickup
member.summary: Item will be picked up from a physical location

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.TwoDayService
member.summary: Item will be delivered in two days

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.ThreeDayService
member.summary: Item will be delivered in three days

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.ShippingMethod.Other
member.summary: A shipping method not listed

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.TransactionTypes
member.summary: This defines the type of the transaction, it is a very close mapping to the bank accepted types, note the types Refund and Auth are missing as they are handled using dedicated requests.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.TransactionTypes.Unknown
member.summary: Unkonwn transaction type

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.TransactionTypes.Purchase
member.summary: Used for a single purchase where the card is present. This will require that the CVN details are supplied.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.TransactionTypes.Recurring
member.summary: Used for a recurring transaction where the card details have been stored. This transaction type should be used when charging with a Token Customer

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.TransactionTypes.MOTO
member.summary: Mail order or Telephone Transaction. Used when the card is not at hand. Can also be used when charging a Token customer.

member.summary: Possible values returned from the payment providers with regards to verification of card/user details.

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.VerifyStatus.Unchecked
member.summary: No verification

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.VerifyStatus.Valid
member.summary: Verification succeeded

member.name: F:eWAY.Rapid.Enums.VerifyStatus.Invalid
member.summary: Verification failed

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Internals.Services.RapidService
member.summary: Internal Client class that does the invocation of Rapid native API call

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient
member.summary: Public interface to create/query transactions and customers

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.SetCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called to change the credentials the RapidSDKClient is using to communicate with Rapid API.
member.param: Rapid API Key (from MYeWAY)
Password matching the API Key

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.SetVersion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the Rapid API version to use
member.param: Rapid API version

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.Create(eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod,eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction)
member.summary: This Method is used to create a transaction for the merchant in their eWAY account
member.param: Describes where the card details will be coming from for this transaction (Direct, Responsive Shared, Transparent Redirect etc).
Request containing the transaction details

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.Create(eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod,eWAY.Rapid.Models.Customer)
member.summary: This Method is used to create a token customer for the merchant in their eWAY account.
member.param: Describes where the card details will be coming from that will be saved with the new token customer (Direct, Responsive Shared, Transparent Redirect etc).
Request containing the Customer details
member.remarks: Like the CreateTransaction, a PaymentMethod is specified which determines what method will be used to capture the card that will be saved with the customer. Depending on the PaymentMethod the customer may be created immediately, or it may be pending (waiting for Card Details to be supplied by the Responsive Shared Page, or Transparent Redirect). The SDK will use the PaymentMethod parameter to determine what type of transaction to create rather than attempting to determine the method to use implicitly (e.g. from the presence of CardDetails in a Customer).

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.UpdateCustomer(eWAY.Rapid.Enums.PaymentMethod,eWAY.Rapid.Models.Customer)
member.summary: This Method is used to update a token customer for the merchant in their eWAY account.
member.param: Describes where the card details will be coming from that will be saved with the new token customer (Direct, Responsive Shared, Transparent Redirect etc).
Request containing the Customer details

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryCustomer(System.Int64)
member.summary: This method is used to return the details of a Token Customer. This includes masked Card information for displaying in a UI to a user.
member.param: ID returned in the original create request.
member.returns: the details of a Token Customer

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryTransaction(eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionFilter)
member.summary: This method is used to determine the status of a transaction.
member.param: Filter definition for searching by other fields (e.g. invoice ID).
member.remarks: However, it's also of use in situations where anti-fraud rules have triggered a transaction hold. Once the transaction has been reviewed then the status will change, and in some cases the transaction ID as well. So this method can be used by automated business processes to determine the state of a transaction that might be under review.

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryTransaction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets transaction information given an int eWAY transaction ID (wrapper for the version which uses long)
member.param: eWAY Transaction ID for the transaction

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryTransaction(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets transaction information given a long eWAY transaction ID
member.param: eWAY Transaction ID for the transaction

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryTransaction(System.String)
member.summary: Gets transaction information given an access code
member.param: Access code for the transaction to query

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryInvoiceNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Gets transaction information given an invoice number
member.param: Merchant’s Invoice Number for the transaction

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.QueryInvoiceRef(System.String)
member.summary: Gets transaction information given an invoice reference
member.param: The merchant's invoice reference

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.IRapidClient.Refund(eWAY.Rapid.Models.Refund)
member.summary: Refunds all or part of a previous transaction
member.param: Contains the details of the Refund

member.summary: Complete an authorised transaction with a Capture request

member.summary: List of all validation, processing, fraud or system errors that occurred when processing this request. Null if no errors occured. This member combines all errors related to the request.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CodeDetail.ErrorCode

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateCustomerResponse
member.summary: The response is returned from a CreateTransaction method call. It will echo back the details of the Customer that has been, or will be, created.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateCustomerResponse.Customer
member.summary: The Customer created by the method call. This will echo back the properties of the Customer adding the TokenCustomerID for the created customer.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateCustomerResponse.SharedPaymentUrl
member.summary: (Only for payment method of ResponsiveShared) URL to the Responsive Shared Page that the cardholder's browser should be redirected to to capture the card to save with the new customer.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateCustomerResponse.FormActionUrl
member.summary: (Only for payment method of TransparentRedirect) URL That the merchant's credit card collection form should post to to capture the card to be saved with the new customer.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateCustomerResponse.AccessCode
member.summary: The AccessCode for this transaction (can be used with the customer query method call for searching before and after the card capture is completed)

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse
member.summary: The response is returned from a CreateTransaction method call. This will echo back the details of the Transaction (Customer, Payment, Items, options etc).

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse.Transaction
member.summary: The Transaction as echoed back by the Rapid API. Where a token customer is created as result of the transaction, then the Customer object in the RequestDetails will contain the token ID.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse.TransactionStatus
member.summary: (Only for Direct payment methods) This contains the status of the processed transaction. Any errors that occurred while processing will be reported using the "Errors" member of the CreateTransactionResponse.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse.SharedPaymentUrl
member.summary: (Only for payment methods of ResponsiveShared) URL to the Responsive Shared Page that the cardholder's browser should be redirected to to complete payment

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse.FormActionUrl
member.summary: (Only for payment methods of TransparentRedirect) URL That the merchant's credit card collection form should post to to complete payment.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse.AccessCode
member.summary: The AccessCode for this transaction (can be used to call query transaction for searching before the transaction has completed processing)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.CreateTransactionResponse.AmexECEncryptedData
member.summary: (Rapid v40 only) A token used to configure AMEX Express Checkout

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Customer.RedirectURL

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Customer.CancelURL
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. This field specifies the URL on the merchant's site that the responsive page will redirect the cardholder to if they choose to cancel the transaction.

member.summary: This response simply wraps the TransactionStatus type with the additional common fields required by a return type.

member.summary: The Request as echoed back by the Rapid API. Where a token customer is created as result of the transaction, then the Customer member in this type will contain the token ID.

member.summary: This contains the status of the processed transaction. Any errors that occurred during processing will be reported using the "Errors" member of the QueryTransactionResponse.

member.summary: The access code for this transaction.

member.summary: The first name of the person the order is shipped to.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.ShippingAddress.Country
member.summary: The customer’s shipping country. This should be the two letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code. This field must be lower case. e.g. Australia = au

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.ShippingAddress.PostalCode

member.summary: The fax number of the shipping location.

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction
member.summary: The details of a transaction that will be processed either via the responsive shared page, by transparent redirect or by Direct.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.TransactionType
member.summary: What type of transaction this is (Purchase, MOTO,etc)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.Capture
member.summary: Set to true to create a regular transaction with immediate capture (default). Set to false to create an Authorisation transaction that can be used in a subsequent transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.SaveCustomer
member.summary: Set to true to create a token when the payment is processed using Transparent Redirect or Shared Page Set to false to process a standard transaction (default)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.Customer
member.summary: Customer details (name address token etc)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.ShippingDetails
member.summary: (optional) Shipping Address, name etc for the product ordered with this transaction

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.PaymentDetails
member.summary: Payment details (amount, currency and invoice information)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.LineItems
member.summary: (optional) Invoice Line Items for the purchase

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.Options
member.summary: (optional) General Options for the transaction

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.DeviceID
member.summary: (optional) Used to supply an identifier for the device sending the transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.PartnerID
member.summary: (optional) Used by shopping carts/ partners.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.ThirdPartyWalletID
member.summary: (optional) This field has been deprecated, please use SecuredCardData instead

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.SecuredCardData
member.summary: (optional) Card data ID, used for Secure Fields, Visa Checkout, AMEX Express Checkout and Android Pay

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.AuthTransactionID
member.summary: (optional) Used with a PaymentType of Authorisation. This specifies the original authorisation that the funds are to be captured from.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.RedirectURL
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a CardSource of TransparentRedirect, or ResponsiveShared This field specifies the URL on the merchant's site that the RapidAPI will redirect the cardholder's browser to after processing the transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CancelURL
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. This field specifies the URL on the merchant's site that the responsive page redirect the cardholder to if they choose to cancel the transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CheckoutURL
member.summary: (optional) The URL used for the integrating PayPal Checkout

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CheckoutPayment
member.summary: (optional) Flag to set if the PayPal Checkout should be used for this

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CustomerIP
member.summary: The customer’s IP address

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CustomerReadOnly
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. Sets whether customers can edit fields on the Responsive Shared Page

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.Language
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. Language code determines the language that the shared page will be displayed in. One of: EN (English, default), ES (Spanish)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CustomView
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. Set the theme of the Responsive Shared Page from 12 available themes: Bootstrap, BootstrapAmelia, BootstrapCerulean, BootstrapCosmo, BootstrapCyborg, BootstrapFlatly, BootstrapJournal, BootstrapReadable, BootstrapSimplex, BootstrapSlate, BootstrapSpacelab, BootstrapUnited

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.VerifyCustomerPhone
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. Set whether the customer’s phone number should be confirmed using Beagle Verify

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.VerifyCustomerEmail
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. Set whether the customer’s email should be confirmed using Beagle Verify

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.HeaderText
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. Short text description to be placed under the logo on the shared page.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.LogoUrl
member.summary: (optional) Used by transactions with a card source of ResponsiveShared. The URL of the merchant’s logo to display on the shared page. This must start with https://.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.TransactionDateTime
member.summary: (v40 query response only) The date and time the transaction took place

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.FraudAction
member.summary: (v40 query response only) The fraud action that occurred if any. One of NotChallenged, Allow, Review, PreAuth, Processed, Approved, Block

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.TransactionCaptured
member.summary: (v40 query response only) True if funds were captured in the transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.CurrencyCode
member.summary: (v40 query response only) The ISO 4217 numeric currency code (e.g. AUD = 036)

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.Source
member.summary: (v40 query response only) Reserved for future use

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.MaxRefund
member.summary: (v40 query response only) The maximum amount that could be refunded from this transaction

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.Transaction.OriginalTransactionId
member.summary: (v40 query response only) Contains the original transaction ID if the queried transaction is a refund

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus
member.summary: Combines together all the status information for a transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.TransactionID
member.summary: The eWAY transaction ID of the transaction. Will only be set once the transaction has been processed or the Authorisation created.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.Total
member.summary: Total in cents.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.Status
member.summary: True if the transaction/authorisation was successful

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.Captured
member.summary: True if the transaction was passed to the bank and funds captured. Depending on the merchant's anti-fraud settings some transactions marked as possibly fraudulent may be held for processing until reviewed. In that case this flag will be set to false. This flag will also be false if the Transaction's 'Capture' flag was set to false (for an explicit authorisation).

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.BeagleScore
member.summary: Floating point number indicating the fraud score.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.FraudAction
member.summary: When an anti-fraud rule has been triggered this will indicate what action was performed with the transaction.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.VerificationResult
member.summary: Status of email, address CVN etc Verification. Also contains Beagle Verify results if the transaction was processed through the responsive shared page.

member.name: P:eWAY.Rapid.Models.TransactionStatus.ProcessingDetails
member.summary: All the various bank/gateway specific details associated with the transaction.

member.summary: Check if the response contains a fraud code

member.name: T:eWAY.Rapid.RapidClientFactory
member.summary: Factory class to create an instance of IRapidSdkClient

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.RapidClientFactory.NewRapidClient(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Static method to create a new Rapid SDK Client configured to communicate with eWAY's Rapid API
member.param: Rapid API Key
Password for the API Key
Possible values ("Production", "Sandbox", or a URL) Production and sandbox will default to the Global Rapid API Endpoints.
member.returns: Native class/object that can be used to create and access business objects such as customers and transactions.

member.name: M:eWAY.Rapid.RapidClientFactory.UserDisplayMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This static/utility method will provide a message suitable for display to a user corresponding to a given Rapid Code/language.
member.param: Rapid API Error Code e.g. "V6023"
Language Code, e.g. "EN" (default) or "ES"
member.returns: String with a description for the given code in the specified language
